lines.text: So... there's gotta be something in the description of this ritual, right?
It's... you gotta draw a normal pentagram, then light candles at the five points...
And then you sacrifice a goat on top. It's... pretty generic.
Honestly, I don't know how these elemental demons even got that one locked down.
Locked down?
When it comes to voluntary sacrificial rituals, the demons usually want them to be easy to pull off.
Like, if you can pick between the demon that wants five dozen different kinds of incense and a physics thesis...
Or the demon down the street that just wants a circle and a few cloves of wyrdroot... you're gonna pick the latter.
If you're intendin' to consort with the forces of hell, sure.
Well, yeah, that goes without saying.
Anyway, there's stiff competition for the really simple ones, to draw in... customers.
The demons behind this ritual must be really old, since they were early enough to snap it up before someone else did.
And... that means the wizards couldn't have done it... why?
What?
The case. The question I asked.
Oh. Right. That.
Um, all of that was totally irrelevant.
For cryin' out loud, Seeker...
Hey, you asked! You can't ask a question like that and not expect me to go on about magic trivia!
'Course I can't. Don't know what I was thinkin'.
But yeah, um, the case... gotta be something in the ritual description that'll give us a clue.
